attributes.action: Double the free child care hours for working parents or single working parent.
attributes.background:
More than one in four UK business leaders say employees have cut their hours because of the "high cost of childcare", a report from the British Chambers of Commerce says.

The government wants to have a lower unemployment rate, so they should consider things like this.
attributes.additional_details: UK jobless rate declined to 4.8 percent in the three months to September 2016 from 4.9 percent in the April to June period and 5.3 percent a year earlier. This could be changed if they helped us with child care costs!

attributes.action: Make it an offence to desecrate National flags or symbols of National importance
attributes.background: Recent events such as the burning of poppies during the remembrance parades have caused anger and division in our society.  Such acts are offensive to the majority of UK citizens and are completely unacceptable in a civilised society such as ours.
attributes.additional_details: The burning or desecration of any of the UK National flags is deeply offensive to a large majority of UK citizens as is burning or destroying of poppies during the period when such symbols are worn to honour the fallen.  We, the petitioners demand that such acts be classed as hate crimes and that the offenders be prosecuted accordingly under the appropriate legislation.

attributes.action: Nationalise rail services
attributes.background: The rail services are too expensive and always late, nationalising them would make them accountable to the public and would mean the profits earnt would actually be reinvested in the train services.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2016/may/13/rail-companies-trains-on-time-delays-cancellations-punctuality?client=safari

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/35790137?client=safari

http://www.itv.com/news/meridian/2016-07-19/southern-rail-more-trains-cancelled-and-delayed-despite-emergency-timetable/

attributes.action: Establish a list of acredited Business Consultants/Mentor organisations.
attributes.background: Business Consultants offer valuable advice to government and SMEs yet remain unregulated.  It is proposed that when engaging, recommending, or working with Business Consultants government bodies and SMEs should be able to refer to an approved provider list of organisations and agencies.
attributes.additional_details: SMEs are seen as the growth engine of the economy yet there is little information for the inexperienced to identify who are credible business consultants and who are not.  There is no overarching governance mechanism, and yet we see numerous initiatives and grants seeking to help this sector. To this extent making available a list of accrediting organisations who exercise not only a quality control scheme for their members but ongoing educational programmes, for example as offered by, the Association of Business Mentor (a body of professional mentors) or such organisations as ibd Business Advice Group (ibd-uk.com – a group of business consultants) would protect both end user and provider.

attributes.action: Discuss measures to increase notifiable disease vaccination uptake.
attributes.background: Most childhood diseases are preventable. The NHS strongly encourages parents to vaccinate via education. However, a small minority of parents refuse. With the number of susceptible children increasing, these diseases are returning, putting lives at risk. New tactics are required to increase uptake.
attributes.additional_details:
Other governments have intervened to increase uptake:
Australia - withholding childcare payments until vaccinated (tinyurl.com/jrk6ll5)
USA - specific vaccination requirements before attending school (tinyurl.com/zswec56)

Discussing and adopting similar approaches in addition to education should increase uptake. Exemptions on health grounds should also be considered.

MMR severe reactions: <1 in 1 million
Measles deaths: before 1980 - 2,600,000 per year, 2015 <135,000.
(tinyurl.com/y8szy8e)

attributes.action: Bring an end to Fast Track Fitness Instructor/Personal Trainer courses
attributes.background:
Training providers who offer you a chance to call yourself a Fitness Professional after a few days need to be stopped.
If these companies are not stopped the standard of Fitness Instructors will keep dropping while the obesity rate gets higher.
Call Full Enquiry into the awarding bodies
attributes.additional_details:
here is an example of types of courses that need to be stopped


https://focus-training.com/courses/full-time-gym-instructor-courses/

If you would like to join discusson on this subject my facebok group is ''Fitness Professionals Association''.

attributes.action: Allow smoking pubs or smoking rooms in certain pubs.
attributes.background: I think landlords/lady's should be able to turn there pubs into smoking or non smoking pubs. As we know pubs are closing everyday and this I believe it due to the smoking ban. If we had both smoking and non smoking it then would be down to the individual which pub they decided to go in.
attributes.additional_details: From 2007 smoking was banned in all public houses. Since this has happened thousands of small family run pubs have been closed down and never reopened. Local communities are suffering through this and so are the owners of the pubs. Allowing a smoking room would be a great space to go for a cigarette allowing people who don't smoke to be well away from it, or make some pubs smoking (at a charge made by government) so that people then have a choice which pub to attend

attributes.action: Brain scans for anyone entering  hospital with head injurys as protocol
attributes.background: When a person has an injury to their head the damage isn't always visible so let's spread the word to get brain scans offered as protocol to anyone entering the hospital with a head injury.
attributes.additional_details: Please help brain injuries get noticed quicker and before it totally changes a family's life by signing this petition, as recently a friend of mine lost their son due to a head injury which he was admitted to hospital with the staff stitched his head and discharged him hours later he was rushed in as collapsed and ended up in a

attributes.action: Can you make funding available to GB Baseball & Softball for the 2020 Olympics?
attributes.background: With the announcement by the Olympic Organisation Committee, the sports of Baseball and Softball will be reinstated at the 2020 Olympics in Tokyo, Japan. There is over 21,000 people, youth, adult, females and males registered with the BBF & BSF and British Baseball Softball United Kingdom, who play.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a wonderful Baseball/Softball  Complex at Farnham Park, Slough. Where the games of both sports are held/played throughout the summer months.
There is also the governing bodies for Baseball and Softball.
The British Baseball Federation for baseball. (BBF)
The British Softball Federation. (BSF)
The British Baseball Softball United Kingdom. (BSUK)
The BSUK is the development  group for British Baseball and Softball.

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: A legal aid framework for victims in the case of IVP dataset compromises.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill requires the creation of huge datasets of citizens online activity. These datasets will be a very tempting target for criminals. The Government should create a legal aid framework that will help any victims in the case of these datasets being compromised.
attributes.additional_details: We realise that as much attention to security will be given as possible in terms of protecting the hardware and the software protecting this data. This does not mean however that a compromise is not possible and attention needs to be given to what will happen in the event of a compromise and what aid can be given to victims. The framework for this aid should be discussed and a framework formalised in advance so that it is clear to each citizen what help and redress they may seek.

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of domestic fireworks for gardens above 85db.
attributes.background: Every year people's pets and children are disturbed by the noise of fireworks for weeks on end around bonfire night. Make it illegal to sell fireworks about 85db to the general public, this is the noise level that is used in measuring noisy environments causing hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks produce a sound output that is in the 150 to 175 decibel range. There is medical evidence that each year, many people experience some damage to their hearing as a result of fireworks. On top of this many animal owners have to sedate cats & dogs, baby birds and rabbits can die of the shock and elderly people find it alarming especially if they live on their own. Displays in gardens pose a much higher problem that organised ones where people are more prepared for their level of noise.

attributes.action: Debate whether self-regulation of the press is adequate.
attributes.background: The UK press is constantly coming under fire for misrepresenting stories and misleading the public with inflammatory opinion pieces that purport to be news items.
attributes.additional_details:
“the press is given significant and special rights in this country ... With these rights, however, come responsibilities to the public interest: to respect the truth, to obey the law and to uphold the rights and liberties of individuals. In short, to honour the very principles proclaimed and articulated by the industry itself (and to a large degree reflected in the Editors’ Code of Practice)”.
- Sir Brian Leveson

Some newspapers are clearly failing to 'respect the truth'.

attributes.action: Make the 5p bag charge go towards the NHS.
attributes.background: I think a better use for the 5p bag charge will be to donate the money to our crippled NHS .

attributes.action: Acknowledge 'secondary modern' schools are created by grammar schools.
attributes.background: The government want to create new grammar schools but say 'secondary modern' schools will not exist. Schools surrounding grammar schools can not contain a full range of pupils of all abilities, this means they are are not truly 'comprehensive' schools. I want this difference officially acknowledged.
attributes.additional_details:
There are currently 163 grammar schools selecting high ability pupils and 400/500 schools with low/medium ability pupil intakes as a result. These 'secondary modern' schools can not perform in the same way as a comprehensive school when the balance of pupils is so different.

Please sign this petition to ask the Department for Education to identify these schools and classify them as 'secondary moderns' or similar new name. This will help us research these schools properly before there are more.

attributes.action: Tackle the pay gap between men and women.
attributes.background:
According to AAUW, the pay gap won’t close until 2152 - lets change that.
Why should women be paid 20% less than a man doing exactly the same job?
Please sign this petition and help us take one more step towards gender equality.

attributes.action: Move the Houses of Parliament to Birmingham.
attributes.background: Houses of Parliament restoration work is estimated to cost £4 billion. We propose a new building on the outskirts of Birmingham near to the Airport and Exhibition Centre. A geographically central home in our second city would be created for Parliament and would provide excellent transport links.

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for travellers to pay for cleaning up once they have moved on
attributes.background: Some travellers who break into land cause damage which they do not have to pay for. This is wrong and creates a system with no incentive to stop them doing it again.
attributes.additional_details:
Around where we live land has been damaged including the local football field. It costs money to get court orders and repair the damage. 

All the council’s costs involved could and should be used for local people instead of wasted due to a lack of punishment to deter this behaviour.

attributes.action: Ban schools from making rules that disallow specific hair colours and piercings.
attributes.background: Students are always told to show their individuality through creativity. How do we do this when schools ban certain hair colours and styles, and facial piercings? "Reasoning" is that it is a distraction from learning, but this isn't so when teachers don't follow the same principle they set.
attributes.additional_details:
Students can be given the same punishment for having (e.g.) pink hair, as someone who has assaulted another pupil - this is something that needs to be rectified.

For example, in one secondary school, a student was threatened with a day's worth of internal exclusion for having a strip of pink hair. The same punishment is given to people in the school who assault others, bully others, and are just genuinely badly behaved...how are these two actions justifiably punishable through the same means?

attributes.action: If Parliament fails to approve an Agreement to Leave, UK shall Remain in EU.
attributes.background: The UK is successful in the EU. Leaving has well known risks.  The Government's position is that, if the government fails to get agreement with the EU approval by Parliament, the UK should leave anyway. The UK should, in that case,  remain in the EU under the treaties, as leaving will have failed.

attributes.action: Reinstate Housing Benefit direct to Landlords, as Tenants do not pay their rent
attributes.background: Reinstate Housing Benefit direct to Landlord. Since payment arrangements were changed, a great number of Landlords are not receiving their rent as it is paid direct to the tenant, this can go on for many months and run to many thousands of pounds of arrears and thousands more in fees to get it back
attributes.additional_details:
Landlords get a bad press, unreasonably. They provide homes where Councils can't or won't. Most aren't rich,  just one property, for example where a couple marry and move in together, renting out the vacant 'other' property.

An example, like myself, adding to their pension. Benefit Tenants payments are paid direct to the Tenant. The recipient has several hundred pounds 'in one go' on many occasions this money is spent, but not on rent...I have experience of Tenants treating this as 'partytime'

attributes.action: Outlaw anti-abortion campaigns near health centres
attributes.background:
Blown-up, graphic images of abortion, and threats to film people attending BPAS surgeries are likely to scare vulnerable people away from the one place they could get state-sanctioned, impartial advice and assistance.

People have a right to express their views but not in a way that harms others.
attributes.additional_details:
It is well-documented that providing safe, non-judgemental access to health and family planning advice leads to an overall decrease in sexual-health related problems. Aggressive campaigning denies that access. 

Victims of abuse or rape, those who are unsure how to cope with pregnancy, contraceptives or sexual health issues might go away in fear then fail to seek help at all -  disastrous for the victims, and likely to create long-lasting problems for their families and social care services.

attributes.action: Fathers to receive the same full paternity pay just the same as mothers.
attributes.background: Currently the government say fathers should only be entitled to 2 weeks paternity leave and £139.58 per week or 90% of weekly average earnings. Whichever is LOWER! Why can't fathers have the same rights to receive full pay like mothers!

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Stop King George Hospital being downgraded to an urgent care centre.
attributes.background: Redbridge could be left without an accident and emergency unit if proposals go ahead – leaving 300,000 out of reach of emergency medical care.
attributes.additional_details: Under the North East London Sustainability and Transformation Plan (STP), the A&E at King George Hospital in Goodmayes, will be downgraded to an urgent care centre, with changes proposed to come into effect by summer 2019. Emergency cases in the borough will instead be taken to Queen's Hospital in Romford, in Havering, or Whipps Cross University Hospital, in Waltham Forest. Whipps Cross was rated as "inadequate" by the Care Quality Commission in December last year. Profit before Patients.

attributes.action: Don't include housing benefit in the benifits cap
attributes.background: The problem with the benifit cap is that if you are in a private let your weekly rent is much higher than if you are in a council or housing association house some family's could have to pay out as much as £150 a week to make up the short fall leaving many in a very bad situation

attributes.action: Allow local councils to keep 100% of Right to Buy receipts.
attributes.background: Under current regulations, councils in England are entitled to pay for 30% of the cost of replacing social housing with funds from the sale of Right to Buy properties. This means that, for every £1 of receipts they keep, they need to raise another £2.30 through loans.
attributes.additional_details:
The sale of social housing through the Right to Buy scheme could have been a good way for local councils to raise much-needed cash to build more homes. Unfortunately, the majority of it has ended up with central government as councils can't find the amounts of money needed to keep the receipts.
We are all well aware of the damage a shortage of available social housing has done and this change would allow the increase in home building that we so desperately need.

attributes.action: Scrap the minimum wage for under 25's and have a blanket wage for all ages
attributes.background: A school leaver with top grades vs a middle aged individual with no qualifications - who deems it fair to give the school leaver £3.20 less just because of their age? Just because they don't have as much life experience? How is it justifiable to disadvantage minors? WE are the future generation!
attributes.additional_details:
Here is the table of the minimum wages. Here you can see a difference between the lowest and highest category of ages. A huge unjustifiable £4 difference in places?

Year	    25 and over	   21 to 24	18 to 20	Under 18	Apprentice
(current rate)	£7.20	£6.95	£5.55	£4.00	£3.40
April 2017	£7.50	£7.05	£5.60	£4.05	£3.50

For example here, say a teenager who is studying at collage 4 days a week lands themselves a part time weekend job; that's 16 hours at £4. £64 a week. £256 a month. It's slavery!

attributes.action: Give more funding into the research of mental health especially anxiety.
attributes.background: People go undiagnosed or even wrongly diagnosed with anxiety and depression every day in the UK. We need more funding into the research and better treatments. I would also like potential financial support for those with anxiety who cannot work.

attributes.action: Remove the powers local authorities have to switch off street lights at  night.
attributes.background: Several authorities have switched off street lights at night, regardless of possible crime and safety consequences. The latest is Surrey County Council, to save £210,000 a year, a mere pittance in relative terms, and an amount that could surely be saved by, for example, axing the Chief Exec post.

attributes.action: Change the age to 25 for the sale of Fireworks
attributes.background: If the law was to change to make it illegal to sell to anyone under 25, I'm confident the constant noise on non celebrating days (Fireworks nt, Diwali & New Year's Eve) would dwindle away. Fireworks started 22/10 until 10/12 & back again 24/12 in Dagenham. They're a nuisance especially to Pets.
attributes.additional_details:
How many reports have we seen this year alone about children being injured by other children launching fireworks at them? As usual to many.
Why are supermarkets allowed to advertise "sales" on Fireworks from 7/11/16? 
In this day & age why can't fireworks be made to make minimal noise?

attributes.action: demolish Devolution powers in the UK
attributes.background: I am petitioning to get rid of Devolution powers in the UK as it has failed. All powers should be returned to Westminster for the good of the UK union

attributes.action: Businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on.
attributes.background:
Its time to create a law that all businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on. 
If everyone does it we can beat the myth that open doors in winter are welcoming, and we can do our part to cut our heating bills and contribute to saving the environment at the same time.

attributes.action: NHS - Give more support to Young Adults
attributes.background: It is extremely worrying & stressful for anyone going to hospital, it is even worse for any young adult (aged 16-20) as whenever you go to clinic, operation or getting a referral done it is extremely difficult, as no one knows where to put you as technically you are too old for children's, but...
attributes.additional_details: ... but are also too young to be in the adults. This is worse when you become an inpatient and they don't know which ward to put you on, and neither is ideal. You spend long periods of uncertainty being passed from departments and you are just waiting for someone to give you the help & support you desperately need. This is a petition for the NHS to give more support and structure within the NHS for Young Adults, (one way do to this would be to introduce specific young adult clinics and wards)

attributes.action: Make physical appearance a protected characteristic.
attributes.background: People feel victimised by an unjust decision to restrict their identity. Having their own hair style and colour makes people feel more comfortable in society, this can make people feel more comfortable with themselves. This should be accepted to give everyone an equal opportunity to be themselves.
attributes.additional_details: In schools, teachers try to dictate hair colour and style. Article 10 of the Human Rights Act states that students should be able to express themselves and make them feel identified without the interference from the authority (teachers being the authority in schools). Also, the same idea applies in article 14. This article was created to try and allow everyone to have equal opportunities for something they may otherwise be judged upon. So why doesn't Article 14 protect physical appearance? All other protected characteristics are things that make people feel more accepted in society because in the past they were not as widely accepted. People should not change the way they look from a style that makes them feel comfortable with themselves, so don't make them.

attributes.action: Bring March into the light
attributes.background: Simple as this - put the clocks forward at the end of Feb instead of March.  It'll still be bright for the morning commute & school run and we'll gain an hour on the evenings, shortening those winter blues. It'll be good for the economy too. Win Win!

attributes.action: Impose stiffer penalties for hand held mobile phone use in vehicles.
attributes.background:
Use of such phones is not diminishing . Evidence from police force videos shows drivers talking and texting or viewing smartphone content. 
Phone logs time stamp usage
Current penalties are not fit for purpose. 
The consequences of accidents caused by such drivers are totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
A Zero Tolerance deterrent is urgently needed to make the results of a conviction more meaningful to the driver and on a par with the offence of drink-driving.  

- An immediate suspension of the driving licence upon apprehension

- On conviction, automatic 12 month disqualification, 6 points on the    licence and £1000 fine, plus seizure of the mobile device.

- If convicted a second time, the courts should be allowed to impose unlimited disqualification, fine or even imprisonment.

attributes.action: Don't force hard working council tenants to pay more rent
attributes.background: George Osborne wants to enforce the law, that if you earn a household income of £30,000 or more (£40,000 in London) you will have to pay equivalent of the private renting sector as of April 2017. He describes it as the 'rich' will no longer have the privilege. Some rents will increase by 300%
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3149748/Osborne-ban-cheap-rents-middle-class-council-tenants-340-000-earning-30-000-pay-market-rate.html

I understand the cut backs are needed, however this is forcing hard working people out of their homes, becoming homeless or being forced onto benefits. The £30,000 household income should not fall into the category of the 'rich' (this is only £15,000 each!  Its encouraging not to work and earn more, but to earn less!

attributes.action: Employers to have mandatory training on hearing impairment & its implications
attributes.background: Most people assume people hearing impaired from birth are fine when they have a hearing aid/s. A hearing aid does not improve someones ability when it comes to processing information. I believe that specific training would be useful to employers in explaining the cognitive process that is required.
attributes.additional_details: Employers don't seem to fully understand the difficulties that people born hearing impaired have when it comes to processing information. Some comments I have received have shown naivety bordering on ignorance. It shocks me how uneducated employers seem to be on a impairment which affects more than 11 million people in the UK. That's one in six of the population. By 2035, it is estimated there will be 15.6 million people with hearing loss in the UK. That's one in five.

attributes.action: Build a relief road for Dove Holes, Derbyshire.
attributes.background: The village is not a suitable route for the high volume of large goods vehicles and commuter traffic that pass through daily. This is a major through route through a residential area that desperately needs a bypass or relief road, both for the Villagers and the road users.

attributes.action: Create CPOs for all derelict properties to house veterans.
attributes.background: We want more Social Housing in the UK. Priority given to those who fought for our freedom. They are, some of them, suffering from PTSD and not so far from danger.
attributes.additional_details: We also want to make sales of MoD land for development conditional on providing housing for ex military personnel.

attributes.action: Regulate locksmithing in the UK
attributes.background: In the UK any one can trade as a locksmith. This means that the person you get to secure your property may not know the standards that are associated with the industry. It is time that this crucial trade is regulated to stop scam locksmiths from operating.
attributes.additional_details: At this time there are several trade associations operating in the UK.  We need to be clear on one operating body that can regulate, vet and ensure that those who trade in this sector are of a minimum standard. This would help to eliminate poor standards of craftsmanship and ensure better security throughout the Uk

attributes.action: Give more mental health training to professionals - emergency services and A&E
attributes.background: I've had trips to A&E and other incidents with the police where I felt the staff weren't adequately trained and aware of mental health

attributes.action: Suspend hospital fines for breaches in 4h waits in Emergency Departments
attributes.background: The Standard Contract for NHS Providers in 2015-16 charges hospitals £120 for every breach of the 4h wait times over the target in Emergency Departments. With unprecedented pressure on Emergency Departments currently this is an absurd system of punishing hospitals for being busy.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Health Committee "Winter pressure in accident and emergency departments Third Report of Session 2016–17" demonstrates that compliance with 4h targets plummets every winter (85% in 2015, 80% in 2016) and demand is currently higher than ever. Hospitals are paying the price of chronic government underfunding of Primary Care and Community Care, and to financially penalise hospitals for flawed government policy is clearly absurd.

attributes.action: All new public transport buses to be either electric or hydrogen fuel by 2018.
attributes.background: Health campaigners say Britain is facing an “air pollution crisis”.  It is estimated that the lives of 40,000 to 50,000 people in the UK are ended prematurely every year.  Yet technology exists to solve this problem.  By introducing new zero emission buses, dirty diesel buses will be phased out.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for Parkinsons sufferers
attributes.background: Cannabis relieves Parkinsons symptoms and dyskinesia caused by Parkinsons drugs

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for shops to tell customers that they sell real fur
attributes.background: Many people believe that the fur industry is a thing of the past and is no longer 'fashionable,' however this is far from the truth. While it has been illegal since 2002 to farm animals for fur in the UK, it is still able to be imported, making it a £500 million industry in the UK every year.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.animalaid.org.uk/images/pdf/factfiles/fur.pdf

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/11/25/faux-fur-or-real_n_8648146.html

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-wear/fur-trade/

attributes.action: Ask retailers to not automatically issue receipts but instead give us an option.
attributes.background:
It is estimated that 12 BILLION receipts are issued in the UK alone each year and most end up in the bin.
By opting to not have your receipt you could help save Rainforests from deforestation, reduce waste, reduce oil and water consumption and help conserve this planet. Retailers also reduce costs.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no requirement under the sale and supply of goods act 1994 act to supply a receipt to prove that a contract exists between buyer and seller, nor is there any requirement to provide physical evidence of any kind, except for the faulty goods/purchase. 

Retailers would also save thousands of pounds in reduced costs.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy drinks to children under 18
attributes.background: The World Health Organisation carried out a review of the literature surrounding energy drinks & found most of potential health risks are related to the caffeine content. In Sweden they are restricted to being sold in pharmacies & are not sold to under 15's.
attributes.additional_details: This information came from NHS choices 2014 (warnings issued over energy drinks) They are likely to become a serious public health issue in the future if they are not more heavily regulated.
